scholarshipDetail: $1,000 per session to assist UTS students with costs associated with participation in the Global Exchange program; awarded on merit to students selected for full‑time exchange who are accepted by their host institution and not already in receipt of another UTS International scholarship

Awarded to top ATAR school‑leaver or gap‑year students commencing a UTS Business School undergraduate degree; valued at $30,000 over three years ($10,000 per year); selection based on Year 12 academic excellence and UAC preference to UTS Business School (domestic applicants only)

course: Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences Undergraduate Student Merit Scholarship
scholarshipDetail: $5,000 to support continuing full‑time undergraduates in the Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences demonstrating financial hardship and academic merit (minimum 48 credit points completed and WAM 75+ preferred); open to Australian/New Zealand citizens and permanent residents with a successful UAC Equity Scholarship application

$5,000 awarded to high‑achieving undergraduates in Civil and Environmental Engineering or Project Management based on academic merit and potential for leadership; open to domestic and international students
$10,000 awarded to female undergraduates in Civil, Construction and Environmental Engineering demonstrating high academic achievement and leadership potential

$10,000 for students in the Faculty of Design, Architecture and Building (including Architecture, Design and Construction disciplines); awarded on the basis of creative portfolio, academic merit and interview
$20,000 awarded to outstanding undergraduates in the Bachelor of Design in Architecture; selection based on academic excellence and design portfolio review

course: WEM Civil Scholarship for Construction and Engineering
scholarshipDetail: $15,000 plus a paid work placement awarded to first‑year undergraduates in Civil and Environmental Engineering demonstrating high academic potential

course: WJ & LM Sinclair Scholarship in Engineering
scholarshipDetail: $10,000–$20,000 per year (depending on number of recipients) for undergraduates in Engineering based on academic merit, leadership and community engagement

course: Engineering and Information Technology Dean’s Scholarship
scholarshipDetail: $30,000 awarded to high‑achieving domestic and international students commencing undergraduate programs in Engineering or Information Technology; selection based on ATAR and academic merit
$10,000 awarded to high‑performing students commencing undergraduate degrees in the Faculty of Health; selection based on ATAR and demonstrated commitment to health disciplines
